channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump threatens to derail Washington Commanders' new stadium deal over team name
item.description: President Trump said the Washington Commanders should change their name back to their former name, which many Indigenous people consider a slur. He threatened to derail a deal for a new stadium.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump said the Washington Commanders should change their name back to their former name, which many Indigenous people consider a slur. He threatened to derail a deal for a new stadium.

(Image credit: Brendan Smialowski)
item.dc:creator: Rob Stein

item.title: Trump administration shuts down EPA's scientific research arm
item.description: The agency is closing the Office of Research and Development, which analyzes dangers posed by hazards including toxic chemicals, climate change, smog, wildfires, water pollution and more.
item.content:encoded:
The agency is closing the Office of Research and Development, which analyzes dangers posed by hazards including toxic chemicals, climate change, smog, wildfires, water pollution and more.

(Image credit: Tierney L. Cross)
item.dc:creator: Rob Stein

item.title: After plea deals are canceled, what happens next with the Guantanamo 9/11 trials?
item.description: Georgetown University Law professor Stephen Vladeck explains where things stand with the 9/11 Guantanamo cases now that the plea deals have been canceled.
item.content:encoded: Georgetown University Law professor Stephen Vladeck explains where things stand with the 9/11 Guantanamo cases now that the plea deals have been canceled.
item.dc:creator: Sacha Pfeiffer

item.title: Nearly 100 people killed seeking aid in Gaza on Sunday, Palestinian officials say
item.description: Dozens of Palestinians were killed across Gaza on Sunday as they tried to get food aid, according to local health authorities, one of the deadliest days in recent months for those seeking assistance.
item.content:encoded:
Dozens of Palestinians were killed across Gaza on Sunday as they tried to get food aid, according to local health authorities, one of the deadliest days in recent months for those seeking assistance.

(Image credit: Jehad Alshrafi)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: Jake Larson, a WWII veteran who became a TikTok star as 'Papa Jake', has died at 102
item.description: Papa Jake Larson joined the US National Guard at 15 years old.
item.content:encoded:
Papa Jake Larson joined the US National Guard at 15 years old.

(Image credit: Thomas Padilla)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: Jane Austen fans mark 250 years since the writer's birth with a wave of parties
item.description: Jane Austen fans are celebrating 250 years since the writer's birth with a series of celebrations – including Georgian costume balls, where attendees try out period dancing.
item.content:encoded:
Jane Austen fans are celebrating 250 years since the writer's birth with a series of celebrations – including Georgian costume balls, where attendees try out period dancing.

(Image credit: Beata Cosgrove)
item.dc:creator: Robbie Griffiths

item.title: Age didn't kill India's beloved centenarian marathon runner. A speeding car did.
item.description: Indian marathon runner Fauja Singh was 114 years old when he was killed in a hit-and-run.
item.content:encoded:
Indian marathon runner Fauja Singh was 114 years old when he was killed in a hit-and-run.

(Image credit: Vincent Yu)
item.dc:creator: Omkar Khandekar

item.title: Most teens have used AI to flirt and chat — but still prefer human interaction
item.description: A new report from the group Common Sense Media shows teens are experimenting with AI "companions" designed to provide deep conversations and advice.
item.content:encoded: A new report from the group Common Sense Media shows teens are experimenting with AI "companions" designed to provide deep conversations and advice.
item.dc:creator: Neda Ulaby

item.title: "We are on our knees": U.S. tariffs devastate Lesotho's garment workers
item.description: The government of the tiny African kingdom of Lesotho has declared a two-year state of disaster, as its once-thriving garment industry unravels in the wake of Trump's tariffs threats.
item.content:encoded:
The government of the tiny African kingdom of Lesotho has declared a two-year state of disaster, as its once-thriving garment industry unravels in the wake of Trump's tariffs threats.

(Image credit: Per-Anders Pettersson)
item.dc:creator: Kate Bartlett

item.title: Exit polls show Japan's ruling coalition is likely to lose key election
item.description: Soaring prices, lagging incomes and burdensome social security payments are the top issues for frustrated, cash-strapped voters. Stricter measures targeting foreign residents and visitors have also emerged as a key issue, with a surging right-wing populist party leading the campaign.
item.content:encoded:
Soaring prices, lagging incomes and burdensome social security payments are the top issues for frustrated, cash-strapped voters. Stricter measures targeting foreign residents and visitors have also emerged as a key issue, with a surging right-wing populist party leading the campaign.

(Image credit: Eugene Hoshiko)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
